title: Sinkhole incident: Periodic patrols to be conducted at location — police
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): The police will continue to monitor and patrol the sinkhole area at Jalan Masjid India here periodically, after the search and rescue operation switched to the search and recovery phase on Saturday (Aug 31).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): The police will continue to monitor and patrol the sinkhole area at Jalan Masjid India here periodically, after the search and rescue operation switched to the search and recovery phase on Saturday (Aug 31).

Dang Wangi district police chief ACP Sulizmie Affendy Sulaiman said this was to ensure public safety around the area.

“I think the Kuala Lumpur City Hall (DBKL) is better suited to issue statements on restoration efforts, while the pol

title: Record-breaking raft pour: The remarkable story of how The Exchange 106’s raft foundation was poured within two days
summary: In the heart of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia’s second-tallest building, The Exchange 106, reaches for the sky as an embodiment of the nation’s ambitions. Designed by Mulia Group Architects and led by its chief development officer Ali Moghaddasi, The Exchange 106 is essentially the centrepiece of the sprawling 70-acre Tun Razak Exchange (TRX) development. What is interesting is that the 454-metre tall icon is known not just for its towering height and contemporary design, but also for its pioneering engineering feat.
content:
Picture by Mulia Property Development

In the heart of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia’s second-tallest building, The Exchange 106, reaches for the sky as an embodiment of the nation

title: Economic lift-off
summary: PETALING JAYA: Although there could be initial hiccups, economists say the RM120bil domestic direct investment (DDI) boost from government-linked investment companies (GLICs) under the Gear-up programme overall will benefit the economy and enhance global competitiveness via private sector investments.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Although there could be initial hiccups, economists say the RM120bil domestic direct investment (DDI) boost from government-linked investment companies (GLICs) under the Gear-up programme overall will benefit the economy and enhance global competitiveness via private sector investments.

However, they said the Ministry of Finance (MoF)-led programme should be, among others, well- structured, carefully implemented and the six GLICs under the programme should pos

title: Antsomi launches Antsomi CDP 365 on LINE OA
summary: PETALING JAYA: Antsomi, a regional marketing technology company, has launched Antsomi CDP 365 on LINE OA, its innovative solution designed for marketing on top of the LINE messaging platform via brands’ LINE Official Account (OA) in the Thai market.
content:
Antsomi co-founder and chief executive officer Serm Teck Choon

PETALING JAYA: Antsomi, a regional marketing technology company, has launched Antsomi CDP 365 on LINE OA, its innovative solution designed for marketing on top of the LINE messaging platform via brands’ LINE Official Account (OA) in the Thai market.

This strategic launch is in collaboration with H+ Thailand, and will be part of their (CRM) one-stop solution, “H+ CRM Suite.” customer relation

title: World’s lowest birth rate spurs S. Korea to hire foreign nannies
summary: Seoul: South Korea will start allowing families to hire foreign nannies as the nation grapples with the world’s lowest birth rate.
content:
Seoul: South Korea will start allowing families to hire foreign nannies as the nation grapples with the world’s lowest birth rate.

A lack of affordable childcare is cited as one of the top concerns among working parents. To address this, the government has given visas to 100 Filipino nannies, who will start working tomorrow.

South Korea suffers from the world’s lowest fertility rate of 0.72 children per woman.

Successive governments have sunk 380 trillion won or

title: Sunway’s earnings forecasts revised upward
summary: PETALING JAYA: Analysts have raised earnings forecasts for Sunway Bhd after factoring in the conglomerate’s solid results in the first half of 2024 (1H24) and its growth prospects.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Analysts have raised earnings forecasts for Sunway Bhd after factoring in the conglomerate’s solid results in the first half of 2024 (1H24) and its growth prospects.

In a recent note, MIDF Research revised its forecast on earnings for Sunway u

title: Guyana raises growth estimates
summary: LONDON: President Irfaan Ali has raised estimates for Guyana’s yearly growth to 42.8% from a prior 34.8%, as he projects “ramped up” investments from the public and private sectors.
content:
Guyana’s economy grew by 49.7% in the first half of 2024. Photographer: Jose A. Alvardo Jr./Bloomberg

LONDON: President Irfaan Ali has raised estimates for Guyana’s yearly growth to 42.8% from a prior 34.8%, as he projects “ramped up” investments from the public and private sectors.

The nation’s economy grew by 49.7% in the first half of 2024, with the oil sector accounting for 67% of that growth, Ali said on a live webcast.

Guyana produced an est

title: Rising CPO prices in 2H to propel Hap Seng
summary: PETALING JAYA: Hap Seng Plantations Holdings Bhd’s second-half (2H) earnings are expected to be better than its 1H on the back of higher sales volume and crude palm oil (CPO) prices, according to CGS International Research (CGSI Research).
content:
PETALING JAYA: Hap Seng Plantations Holdings Bhd’s second-half (2H) earnings are expected to be better than its 1H on the back of higher sales volume and crude palm oil (CPO) prices, according to CGS International Research (CGSI Research).

The company’s second quarter of the year (2Q24) CPO average selling price (ASP) was RM4,247 per tonne, higher than the Malaysian Palm Oil Board Sabah CPO spot price of RM4,038 per tonne.

The research house stated it was worth noting

title: Stabilising growth in chip sector to benefit Oppstar
summary: PETALING JAYA: Oppstar Bhd, an integrated circuit (IC) design services provider, sees growth opportunities in the semiconductor industry despite facing headwinds.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Oppstar Bhd, an integrated circuit (IC) design services provider, sees growth opportunities in the semiconductor industry despite facing headwinds.

In a filing with Bursa Malaysia last week, the group noted it faced headwinds due to increase

title: Global central banks are cutting rates, now what?
summary: IN recent months, the dynamics of global monetary policy have undergone a slight twist. Central banks, laser-focused on taming inflation for the past two years, are shifting their attention towards sustaining economic growth.
content:
US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell. — Bloomberg

IN recent months, the dynamics of global monetary policy have undergone a slight twist. Central banks, laser-focused on taming inflation for the past two years, are shifting their attention towards sustaining economic growth.

This change in focus is becoming more apparent as several major central banks have started to adjust their interest rates.

Interestingly, the policy move was less about lowe

title: Pansar and JV partner secure RM805mil contract
summary: KUCHING: Pansar Bhd’s wholly-owned subsidiary Perbena Emas Sdn Bhd (PESB) and its joint-venture (JV) partner China Road & Bridge Corp (CRBC) have been awarded a RM804.7mil contract for the Kuching Urban Transportation System (KUTS).
content:
KUCHING: Pansar Bhd’s wholly-owned subsidiary Perbena Emas Sdn Bhd (PESB) and its joint-venture (JV) partner China Road & Bridge Corp (CRBC) have been awarded a RM804.7mil contract for the Kuching Urban Transportation System (KUTS).

title: The Week Ahead
summary: - AZMAN GHANI/ The StarOvernight policy rateBANK Negara’s fifth monetary policy meeting is set to take the spotlight this week, with the Monetary Policy Committee scheduled to convene on Sept 4 and Sept 5.Economists widely expect the central bank to keep ...
content:
- AZMAN GHANI/ The Star

Overnight policy rate

BANK Negara’s fifth monetary policy meeting is set to take the spotlight this week, with the Monetary Policy Committee scheduled to convene on Sept 4 and Sept 5.

Economists widely expect the central bank to keep the overnight policy rate steady at 3%.

According to a Bloomberg poll, all three analysts surveyed expect Bank Negara to keep its policy rate steady at 3%.

title: Sarawak sets ambitious RE mix target by 2030
summary: KUCHING: Sarawak targets to have solar energy make up 12% of its total capacity mix in electricity generation by 2030.
content:
KUCHING: Sarawak targets to have solar energy make up 12% of its total capacity mix in electricity generation by 2030.

Stating this Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg said the state had set an ambitious goal to achieve a 10-gigawatt renewable energy (RE) mix by 2030.

“Sarawak’s shift to a green economy depends greatly on sustainable energy. We are actively exploring innovative methods to harness energy through hydropower potential, solar, biomass, sustainab

title: Three Libyan oil fields to resume production
summary: LONDON: Libya’s Sarir, Messla and Nafoura oilfields have received instructions to resume production, engineers at the three fields told Reuters last Saturday, after a standoff between rival political factions shut most of the country’s oilfields.
content:
LONDON: Libya’s Sarir, Messla and Nafoura oilfields have received instructions to resume production, engineers at the three fields told Reuters last Saturday, after a standoff between rival political factions shut most of the country’s oilfields.

The resumption order was made by the fields’ operator, the Arabian Gulf Oil Company, which did not provide any reasons, according to the engineers.

A struggle to control the Central Bank of Libya (CBL) has sparked a blockade o

title: The ECB’s hurry may owe much to deepening EU-China trade
summary: WHILE there has been a lot of talk about the West’s strategic decoupling from China’s sputtering economy, Europe’s direct trade links with Beijing have actually been deepening.
content:
Acting fast: A euro symbol sculpture is seen at the ECB headquarters in Frankfurt, Germany. The bank is expected to deliver a second interest rate cut before the Fed even gets going soon. — Bloomberg

WHILE there has been a lot of talk about the West’s strategic decoupling from China’s sputtering economy, Europe’s direct trade links with Beijing have actually been deepening.

This difference may help to explain some of the divergence in monetary easing be

title: Medical tourism a boon for KPJ Healthcare’s revenue
summary: PETALING JAYA: Analysts are overall positive on KPJ Healthcare Bhd’s earnings growth, having taken into account the increase in medical tourism and more hospitals in its portfolio turning profitable.TA Research in a report stated the expected hike in ...
content:
PETALING JAYA: Analysts are overall positive on KPJ Healthcare Bhd’s earnings growth, having taken into account the increase in medical tourism and more hospitals in its portfolio turning profitable.

TA Research in a report stated the expected hike in medical tour

title: Havas Malaysia’s Proton e.MAS job a high point
summary: PETALING JAYA: Havas Malaysia has been appointed to lead the integrated mandate for Proton e.MAS, the latest sub-brand under the national carmaker Proton’s expanding electric vehicle (EV) portfolio, following its official launch in June.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Havas Malaysia has been appointed to lead the integrated mandate for Proton e.MAS, the latest sub-brand under the national carmaker Proton’s expanding electric vehicle (EV) portfolio, following its official launch in June.

The management of Proton e.MAS is handled by Pro-Net Sdn Bhd, a subsidiary of Proton, which was established to spearhead the sales and distribution of new energy vehicles, including those under the smart brand.

Proton e.MAS is an acron

title: Growth of data centre industry supports country’s transition to RE
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia’s status as South-East Asia’s fastest growing data centre hub will not only spur the growth of the digital economy but also be a catalyst in the nation’s transition towards renewable energy (RE).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia’s status as South-East Asia’s fastest growing data centre hub will not only spur the growth of the digital economy but also be a catalyst in the nation’s transition towards renewable energy (RE).

Dr Jasrul Jamani Jamian, associate professor at Universiti Teknologi Malaysia’s Electrical Engineering Faculty, said the inflow of data centre players to Malaysia helps the government in optimising the country’s existing electricity generation capacity.

title: Tokyo inflation for August tops expectations
summary: Tokyo: Inflation in Tokyo picked up speed in August, supporting the case for the Bank of Japan (BoJ) to continue raising rates at a gradual pace as the bank balances the need to support the economy.
content:
Rising costs: People dining in Tokyo. Consumer prices in the capital rose 2.4% in August, accelerating from the 2.2% growth in July. — Reuters

Tokyo: Inflation in Tokyo picked up speed in August, supporting the case for the Bank of Japan (BoJ) to continue raising rates at a gradual pace as the bank balances the need to support the economy.

Consumer prices excluding fresh food rose 2.4% in the capital, an acceleration from 2.2% growth in July, the Intern

title: Aviva ‘engaging’ with authorities over India tax investigation
summary: NEW DELHI: British insurer Aviva says its India unit is “actively engaging” with local authorities in connection with alleged tax evasion practices.
content:
The Indian flag and Aviva logo are seen in this illustration picture taken August 29, 2024. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

NEW DELHI: British insurer Aviva says its India unit is “actively engaging” with local authorities in connection with alleged tax evasion practices.

Reuters reported last Friday that an Indian tax agency has found that Aviva India breached local regulations capping commissions to sales agents with a system of fake invoi

title: Police seek ‘Datuk Seri’ in Myanmar human trafficking investigation
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): Police are on the hunt for a man with the title ‘Datuk Seri’ to assist in investigations into a human trafficking case in Myanmar, which also allegedly involves a politician and her husband.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): Police are on the hunt for a man with the title ‘Datuk Seri’ to assist in investigations into a human trafficking case in Myanmar, which also allegedly involves a politician and her husband.

Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Razarudin Husain said that so far, statements have been taken from three individuals, including the politician and her spouse.

“We are currently tracking down one more person for questioning, and will also call in th

title: Proposal being considered for plantation firms to return 20% of leased land to state govts to renew lease — Ahmad Zahid
summary: BAGAN DATUK (Sept 1): A proposal is being considered for plantation companies whose land leases with the government have expired, to return 20% of the leased land to the state government if they wish to renew the lease.
content:
BAGAN DATUK (Sept 1): A proposal is being considered for plantation companies whose land leases with the government have expired, to return 20% of the leased land to the state government if they wish to renew the lease.

Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi said this proposal is currently being thoroughly reviewed by the Bumiputera Economic Council (MEB), in collaboration with state governments and the federal territories, before it is implemented.

title: AirAsia celebrates maiden flight from Kota Kinabalu to Manado, North Sulawesi
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): AirAsia celebrated on Sunday, its maiden flight from Kota Kinabalu, Sabah to Manado, the capital city of North Sulawesi and the second largest city in Indonesia’s Sulawesi island.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): AirAsia celebrated on Sunday, its maiden flight from Kota Kinabalu, Sabah to Manado, the capital city of North Sulawesi and the second largest city in Indonesia’s Sulawesi island.

Operated by AirAsia Malaysia, the flight departed Kota Kinabalu International Airport at 8.50am and landed at Sam Ratulangi International Airport at 11.00am local time, AirAsia said in a statement here on Sunday.

Flight AK1797 was given the customary wa

title: Ahmad Zahid stands firm, ready for probe over alleged deception in govt formation
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi said he is ready to be investigated over allegations that he may have misled the 16th Yang di-Pertuan Agong when submitting statutory declarations (SDs) for the formation of the Unity Government.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi said he is ready to be investigated over allegations that he may have misled the 16th Yang di-Pertuan Agong when submitting statutory declarations (SDs) for the formation of the Unity Government.

Ahmad Zahid, who is also Barisan Nasional (BN) chairman, said he has evidence and was fully open to investigations by the relevant authorities, including the police, Registrar of Societies (ROS) and the Attorney General’s Chambers.

title: MCMC to engage social media platform providers this month, says Teo
summary: KULAI (Sept 1): The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) will hold an engagement session with social media platform providers this month, to discuss standard operating procedures (SOPs) concerning the personal content of users.
content:
KULAI (Sept 1): The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) will hold an engagement session with social media platform providers this month, to discuss standard operating procedures (SOPs) concerning the personal content of users. 

Deputy Communications Minister Teo Nie Ching said the meeting also aims to establish cooperation with these providers, to ensure that personal data is not misused by irresponsible parties.

"This month, MCMC

title: Op Tiris 3.0: 496 individuals arrested, over RM80m worth of goods seized — Armizan
summary: KUDAT (Sept 1): A total of 496 individuals were detained and RM80.11 million worth of controlled and subsidised goods were seized during an operation, Op Tiris 3.0,  from Jan 1 to Aug 28 this year.
content:
KUDAT (Sept 1): A total of 496 individuals were detained and RM80.11 million worth of controlled and subsidised goods were seized during an operation, Op Tiris 3.0,  from Jan 1 to Aug 28 this year.

 Minister of Domestic Trade and Cost of Living Datuk Armizan Mohd Ali said 29,487 inspections were conducted nationwide during the same period, resulting in 2,005 recorded cases. He stated that during the same period, 29,487 inspections were carried out nationwide, resulting in 2,005 cases recorded.

title: MyPPP’s appeal to be presented to BN Supreme Council for consideration — Ahmad Zahid
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): The People's Progressive Party’s (MyPPP) appeal to rejoin the Barisan Nasional (BN) coalition will be brought to the BN Supreme Council for consideration, said BN chairman Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): The People's Progressive Party’s (MyPPP) appeal to rejoin the Barisan Nasional (BN) coalition will be brought to the BN Supreme Council for consideration, said BN chairman Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi.

Ahmad Zahid said that MyPPP leaders made the appeal after the Registrar of Societies (ROS) recognised the validity of the party's Supreme Council members on April 11 last year.

“The BN Supreme Council will discuss and consider both

title: Parties in Unity Govt pledge support to defend Mahkota seat — Mohamed Khaled
summary: KOTA TINGGI (Sept 1): All component parties in the Unity Government have pledged their full support to assist the Barisan Nasional (BN) candidate in the Mahkota state by-election, scheduled for Sept 28 this year.
content:
KOTA TINGGI (Sept 1): All component parties in the Unity Government have pledged their full support to assist the Barisan Nasional (BN) candidate in the Mahkota state by-election, scheduled for Sept 28 this year.

Umno vice-president and BN coordinator for the by-election Datuk Seri Mohamed Khaled Nordin noted that this support has provided BN with renewed momentum to defend the state seat.

“We are coordinating effectively and have secured cooperation f

title: Dying corals and dwindling fish populations
summary: Malaysia’s pristine marine ecosystems are facing a crisis, where thriving coral reefs and diverse fish populations are now threatened by rising sea temperatures, ocean acidification and extreme weather events.
content: This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on August 12, 2024 - August 18, 2024

title: New Zealand’s PM Luxon arrives in Malaysia for official visit
summary: SEPANG (Sept 1): New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon arrived in Malaysia on Sunday for a three-day official visit.
content:
SEPANG (Sept 1): New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon arrived in Malaysia on Sunday for a three-day official visit.

This is Luxon’s first visit to Malaysia since taking office as prime minister in November 2023.

Luxon, who arrived at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA Terminal 1) here on a commercial flight, was met by Deputy Digital Minister Datuk Wilson Ugak Anak Kumbong at the Bunga Raya Complex at 7.55pm.

title: SkyWorld expands into Vietnam with second property project
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: SkyWorld Development Bhd, through its wholly-owned subsidiary SkyWorld Development (Vietnam) Co Ltd (Sky World Vietnam), will undertake a second project in Vietnam.SkyWorld Vietnam has entered into a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with SkyVenue Land Group Joint Stock ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: SkyWorld Development Bhd, through its wholly-owned subsidiary SkyWorld Development (Vietnam) Co Ltd (Sky World Vietnam), will undertake a second project in Vietnam.

SkyWorld Vietnam has entered into a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with SkyVenue Land Group Joint Stock Company, SkyBridge Co Ltd, and the shareholders of SkyVenue to jointly develop the remaining plots of the Guocoland Commercial Complex project in Thuan An City, Binh Duong Province.

In a statement, the property developer said that the collab

title: Yinson divests its offshore support vessel business for RM160mil
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Yinson Holdings Berhad is divesting its offshore support vessel (OSV) business to Icon Offshore Bhd for RM160 million.Its subsidiary, Yinson Offshore Services Sdn Bhd, has signed a binding term sheet with Icon Offshore, with the transaction being ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Yinson Holdings Berhad is divesting its offshore support vessel (OSV) business to Icon Offshore Bhd for RM160 million.

Its subsidiary, Yinson Offshore Services Sdn Bhd, has signed a binding term sheet with Icon Offshore, with the transaction being settled via the issuance of 181.8 million new Icon shares at 88 sen per share, according to a filing with Bursa Malaysia.

Under the agreement, Yinson will sell its entire 70 per cent equity interest and 100 per cent of the non-convertible redeemable preference shar

title: UMP Holdings rebranded as UMPSA Holdings effective Sept 1
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: UMP Holdings Sdn Bhd has been rebranded as UMPSA Holdings Sdn Bhd effective from Sept 1, 2024.Group chief executive officer Syed Alwi Mohamed Sultan said the move is in line with the rebranding of Universiti Malaysia Pahang (UMP) as ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: UMP Holdings Sdn Bhd has been rebranded as UMPSA Holdings Sdn Bhd effective from Sept 1, 2024.

Group chief executive officer Syed Alwi Mohamed Sultan said the move is in line with the rebranding of Universiti Malaysia Pahang (UMP) as Universiti Malaysia Pahang Al-Sultan Abdullah (UMPSA) effective April 14, 2023. 

UMP Holdings Sdn Bhd has been rebranded as UMPSA Holdings Sdn Bhd, effective Sept 1, 2024.

Group chief executive officer Syed Alwi Mohamed Sultan said that this rebranding aligns with the ren

title: Mindef sets October deadline for delivery of Black Hawk helicopters
summary: KOTA TINGGI (Sept 1): The Ministry of Defence (Mindef) has given Aerotree Defence and Services Sdn Bhd until October to deliver four UH-60A Black Hawk helicopters to the Malaysian Army (TDM).
content:
KOTA TINGGI (Sept 1): The Ministry of Defence (Mindef) has given Aerotree Defence and Services Sdn Bhd until October to deliver four UH-60A Black Hawk helicopters to the Malaysian Army (TDM).

Its minister Datuk Seri Mohamed Khaled Nordin said that the helicopter lease contract would be cancelled if the vendor failed to meet this deadline.

“We are giving them until October for delivery. If the Black Hawk helicopters are not delivered by then, the contract will be

title: OpenAI, Meta flex muscles as AI race heats up
summary: SAN FRANCISCO: The world's biggest AI companies are releasing new usage data showing significant growth as competition in the generative artificial intelligence sector heats up.The pressure to show that ChatGPT-style AI chatbots are being adopted by the wider ...
content:
SAN FRANCISCO: The world's biggest AI companies are releasing new usage data showing significant growth as competition in the generative artificial intelligence sector heats up.

The pressure to show that ChatGPT-style AI chatbots are being adopted by the wider public is significant given the huge costs of delivering the technology.

The numbers could help quiet the small but growing group of naysayers that are asking to see bigger and quicker revenue from AI chatbots and other tools.

OpenAI, the creator of ChatG

title: China's August manufacturing slips to 6-month low
summary: BEIJING: China's manufacturing slowed to a six-month low in August, an official factory survey showed on Saturday, raising expectations policymakers will unveil fresh plans to direct more stimulus to households and less to infrastructure projects.The official purchasing managers' ...
content:
BEIJING: China's manufacturing slowed to a six-month low in August, an official factory survey showed on Saturday, raising expectations policymakers will unveil fresh plans to direct more stimulus to households and less to infrastructure projects.

The official purchasing managers' index (PMI) declined for a fourth month to 49.1 in August from 49.4 in July, below the 50-mark separating growth from contraction and missing a median forecast of 49.5 in a Reuters poll.

In contrast, the non-manufacturing PMI, which in

title: Malaysians abroad celebrate 67th National Day with patriotic ceremonies
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): The Malaysian community in Hungary celebrated Malaysia's 67th National Day and 61st Malaysia Day with a vibrant and patriotic gathering at the Malaysian embassy in Budapest.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): The Malaysian community in Hungary celebrated Malaysia's 67th National Day and 61st Malaysia Day with a vibrant and patriotic gathering at the Malaysian embassy in Budapest. 

In a statement, the Malaysian embassy in Budapest said the event, which was held on Aug 31 (Saturday), featured a flag-hoisting ceremony that served as a powerful reminder of Malaysia's rich history and the value of independence and sovereignty.

The ceremony bega

title: Malaysia's rise as SEA's fastest-growing data centre hub vital for shift to RE
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's rise as Southeast Asia's fastest-growing data centre hub is poised to not only accelerate the digital economy but also play a crucial role in the country's transition to renewable energy (RE).According to Dr. ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia's rise as Southeast Asia's fastest-growing data centre hub is poised to not only accelerate the digital economy but also play a crucial role in the country's transition to renewable energy (RE).

According to Dr. Jasrul Jamani Jamian, an associate professor at Universiti Teknologi Malaysia's Faculty of Electrical Engineering, the increasing presence of data centre operators in Malaysia is helping the government optimise the country's existing electricity generation capacity.

title: Malaysia to contest for Unesco executive board seat — minister
summary: PUTRAJAYA (Sept 1): Malaysia will vie for a seat on the Executive Board of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (Unesco) for the 2025 to 2029 term, according to the Ministry of Education (MOE).
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Sept 1): Malaysia will vie for a seat on the Executive Board of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (Unesco) for the 2025 to 2029 term, according to the Ministry of Education (MOE).

MOE said Minister of Education Fadhlina Sidek as president of the Malaysian National Commission for Unesco (MNCU) will officially announce Malaysia's candidacy to compete during a meeting with Unesco deputy director-general Xing Qu in Paris, France.

title: Rubber market likely to trade higher next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The local rubber market is expected to trade higher next week on the back of poorer yields influenced by non-stop heavy rainfall in rubber producing countries, said industry expert Denis Low.He said the northern part of Peninsular ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The local rubber market is expected to trade higher next week on the back of poorer yields influenced by non-stop heavy rainfall in rubber producing countries, said industry expert Denis Low.

He said the northern part of Peninsular Malaysia and Thailand are experiencing abnormal weather conditions, prompting Thailand's meteorological department to issue a heavy rainfall warning and advised residents to prepare for heavy to very heavy rainfall, flash floods and forest runoffs.

"There is a disparity in de

title: South Korea exports extend gains to 11th month, growth slows
summary: SEOUL: South Korea's exports rose for an 11th straight month in August, but the pace of growth was weaker than the previous month and market expectations as demand for computer chips slowed, while auto sales remained sluggish.Overseas sales ...
content:
SEOUL: South Korea's exports rose for an 11th straight month in August, but the pace of growth was weaker than the previous month and market expectations as demand for computer chips slowed, while auto sales remained sluggish.

Overseas sales by Asia's fourth-largest economy rose 11.4 per cent year-on-year to $57.90 billion, trade data showed on Sunday, slowing from a gain of 13.9 per cent in the previous month, which was the fastest in six months.

It was also weaker than a 13.0 per centincrease tipped in a Reute

title: Avoid raising issues on social media that could harm racial harmony — Tiong
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 31): Minister of Tourism, Arts, and Culture Datuk Seri Tiong King Sing has urged all parties to refrain from creating issues on social media that could lead to misunderstandings, or harm racial unity and harmony in the country.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 31): Minister of Tourism, Arts, and Culture Datuk Seri Tiong King Sing has urged all parties to refrain from creating issues on social media that could lead to misunderstandings, or harm racial unity and harmony in the country.

Commenting on the criticism of a viral video promoting Melaka tourism, which was alleged to focus on elements of a single ethnicity, he said it should not be made an issue.

Tiong said a check by the ministry found t

title: Air India to operate Vistara flights from November as merger gets key approval
summary: NEW DELHI: Indian carrier Vistara said on Friday its planes would be operated by Air India from November as a merger between Vistara and the country's flag carrier gained momentum following a key Indian government approval.Singapore Airlines, which ...
content:
NEW DELHI: Indian carrier Vistara said on Friday its planes would be operated by Air India from November as a merger between Vistara and the country's flag carrier gained momentum following a key Indian government approval.

Singapore Airlines, which owns 49% of Vistara in a joint venture with India's Tata Group said it had received approval for foreign direct investment into an expanded Air India, clearing a significant hurdle in the merger process.

Singapore's flagship carrier announced a plan to merge the

title: Netherland's Schipol airport: to invest 6 billion eur over next five years to boost capacity
summary: AMSTERDAM: Amsterdam's Schipol airport, one of Europe's main aviation hubs, on Friday announced what it called the largest investment plan in its history, pledging to invest 6 billion euros ($6.65 billion) by 2029.The airport extended a previously announced investment volume ...
content:
AMSTERDAM: Amsterdam's Schipol airport, one of Europe's main aviation hubs, on Friday announced what it called the largest investment plan in its history, pledging to invest 6 billion euros ($6.65 billion) by 2029.

The airport extended a previously announced investment volume of 3 billion euros from 2024-2027, saying large parts of the planned renewal and maintenance works at the airport would continue afterwards.

"Our infrastructure is the foundation of our service, but is currently far from what we want to off

title: China's top airlines post losses, hit by slow international travel and domestic oversupply
summary: BEIJING: China's leading state-owned airlines posted losses in the first half of the year, weighed down by a slower-than-expected international travel rebound, domestic oversupply and more intense competition as aviation capacity returns globally.China's top three airlines, Air ...
content:
BEIJING: China's leading state-owned airlines posted losses in the first half of the year, weighed down by a slower-than-expected international travel rebound, domestic oversupply and more intense competition as aviation capacity returns globally.

China's top three airlines, Air China, China Southern Airlines and China Eastern Airlines , last reported annual net profits in 2019 before the COVID-19 pandemic took hold.

The country's flagship carrier Air China posted a first-half net loss of 2.78 billion yuan

title: Gloss in translation
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): Child of the cinema and a bona fide style icon, Oscar-winning director Sofia Coppola releases a line of sheer tinted lip balms in collaboration with cult skincare brand Augustinus Bader.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): Child of the cinema and a bona fide style icon, Oscar-winning director Sofia Coppola releases a line of sheer tinted lip balms in collaboration with cult skincare brand Augustinus Bader. 

“I wrote a note to Professor Bader and asked if he’d consider making a balm with my favourite tint. I wanted something moisturising, non-sticky and sheer enough that you can put on without a mirror. When he said yes, I was really happy,” enthuses Coppola, who lent her tastemaker credentials to the

title: Conserving Malaysia’s historical buildings
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): In conjunction with Merdeka Day, City & Country spoke to Badan Warisan Malaysia’s Lim Wei-Ling, Malaysian Institute of Architects’ Dexter Koh and Datuk Zulkhairi Md Zain, Think City’s Datuk Abdul Hamdan Majeed, as well as Arkitek LLA Sdn Bhd’s Laurence Loh on the importance of conserving historical and heritage buildings in Malaysia and the government’s effort in furthering the conservation cause.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 1): In conjunction with Merdeka Day, City & Country spoke to Badan Warisan Malaysia’s Lim Wei-Ling, Malaysian Institute of Architects’ Dexter Koh and Datuk Zulkhairi Md Zain, Think City’s Datuk Abdul Hamdan Majeed, as well as Arkitek LLA Sdn Bhd’s Laurence Loh on the importance of conserving historical and heritage buildings in Malaysia and the government’s effort in furthering the conservation cause.
